FuncDef:
The snmp-agent trap source command specifies the source interface for sending traps.
The undo snmp-agent trap source command deletes the specified source interface for sending traps. The snmp-agent trap source command specifies the source interface for sending traps. The undo snmp-agent trap source command deletes the specified source interface for sending traps. By default, no source interface is specified for sending traps.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of the source interface that sends trap messages.
-

Specifies the type of the source interface that sends trap messages.
-

Specifies the number of the source interface that sends trap messages.
-

ExtraInfo: To specify the type and number of a source interface with a specific IP address used to send SNMP trap messages, run the snmp-agent trap source command. The device uses the IPv4 address of the source interface as the source IPv4 address for sending traps.
